attributes.action: The UK government to set out sanctions on trade with the Faroe Islands.
attributes.background: In light of the deliberate slaughter of 1486 white-sided dolphins on the shores of the Faroe Islands
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has recently signed a £200,000,000 trade deal with the Faroe Islands. The UK and DEFRA are committed to high standards of animal welfare and preservation of wildlife. 
If we are to forge stronger trading relationships with the Faroe Islands we need to hold them to account to our own national standards of animal welfare.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597171

attributes.action: Stop construction of 5G masts in residential and environmentally sensitive areas
attributes.background: Stop Permitted Development, which allows  phone companies to erect 5G or future phone masts, in residential /  environmentally sensitive areas. Phone companies should replace and share existing masts on used brownfield sites rather than new sites. Councils and residents should always be consulted.
attributes.additional_details:
A mobile company recently applied to construct a 20m 5G mast on a residential green space impacting the local amenity. This green space includes several mature ash and lime trees, as well as protected wildlife. 

Residents raised 191 objections, plus an objection from the Council Tree Officer, resulting in the application being rejected.

However, under the new Planning Bill, neither the council nor the residents will be allowed to raise objections to developments of this kind.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure if you want a ban on 5G masts in residential and environmentally sensitive areas, or for people to have the right to block proposals. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: There it too much litter on the floor and in the ocean harming wildlife.
attributes.background: I would like the Government to place more bins around parks and communal areas and to use more recyclable plastics in bottles and packaging.
attributes.additional_details: I would also like the Government to sell bio-degradable and compostable bags in all shops and to encourage the people of the UK to use less Fossil fuel you can do this by going on bike rides more often and going on walks .

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Councils are responsible for litter provision. You might like to sign these petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584072
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566467

Shops are responsible for deciding on the bags they sell, but you might like to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581139

attributes.action: Stop the discrimination against grey squirrels. .
attributes.background: Grey squirrells should be protected by the government.its about time they were  recognised as Part of our British wildlife. Since been introduced in the the UK by the Victorians
attributes.additional_details: https://nedhardy.com/2020/02/10/squirrels-plant-trees/amp/ here is the link about trees been grown when grey squirrels forget where food is buried squirrels also bring joy in peoples gardens.  I think it's cruel to poison and shoot them

rejection.details: We can see that you want the Government to take action to protect grey squirrels, but it's not clear how you would like the Government to do this. You might like to start a new petition asking for a specific way in which the Government can better protect grey squirrels.

attributes.action: OUT OF HOURS OPTION NEEDED TO SAVE WILDLIFE (AT WILDLIFE CENTRES)
attributes.background: Many animals that I myself have experienced suffer greatly due to Leck of urgent care during late evenings and nights. This After hours option is needed to those willing to bring the animals to the centers.
attributes.additional_details: No urgent care when its a life and death situation. Instead they end up in peoples homes or left on the side of a road. We so desperately want to get the animals the help it needs to Survive and then deeply saddened,lefted helpless when we are told there's no help available. Wildlife in the UK are loved and a great importance to us all. We need to save all the wildlife we can at this time of crisis. Give our wildlife the love and care when they need us the most. SAVE THEM, SAVE US.

rejection.details:
Wildlife centres and veterinary practices are privately operated, so their opening hours and operations are matter for individual centres and practices, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Creating a new Animal Health Service (AHS) for free medical treatment in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332097

attributes.action: Give food companies a year to reduce their plastic packaging by at least 50%.
attributes.background:
Put pressure on food companies especially those who sell to supermarkets to reduce their plastic packaging.
Single use plastic is damaging the environment and wildlife. Alternatives like paper can be easily used.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment citizens are responsible for being the “demand” for products meaning we’re being blamed for choosing products with high plastic content. However there is not much of a choice when everything you find in the supermarket is covered in single use plastic polluting the world.

rejection.details:
Petitions needs to call on the Government or House of Commons to take a specific action. We understand that you're concerned about the impact of food packaging, but it's not clear what you want the Government to do about this.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban selling drinks bottles that aren’t made out of a sustainable material: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311520

Ban plastic wrapping of individual items of fruit or vegetables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551544

Increase VAT tax on products that utilize or contain plastic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550925

If you would like the Government to take an action not covered by the above petitions, you could start a new petition requesting this, but it would need to be clear what action you want the Government to take.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of barbecues in foil trays.
attributes.background: A child of 2 on Exmouth beach received 2nd degree burns walking on sand covering a tin foil barbecue which had not been extinguished.  Many examples exist of the anti social nature of these convenience barbecues, fire risk and danger to wildlife and farm animals.
attributes.additional_details: Barbecues sold most frequently in supermarkets in tin trays have become a nuisance.  They cause polluting smoke on busy beaches. They are a significant cause of litter.  Often left buried on beaches causing a serious burn hazard if walked over in bare feet. Fire hazard on heaths and commons.  Fire ha,ard in municipal litter bins.  Altogether anti-social and potentially dangerous.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Impose fines for discarding face coverings in an antisocial way.
attributes.background: Since the mandating of face covers, it has become apparent that some people are discarding their face coverings in an anti social manner. I have visited beaches, forests, parks and many other areas, both urban and rural, and have been disgusted at the total disrespect shown to the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
We should be able to go for walks, swim, picnic and exercise, without having to encounter used face coverings that not only make the immediate area unpleasant, but could potentially cause harm, both to people as well as wildlife.
I feel that a fine should be imposed on people caught discarding their face coverings in this way. Fines should be fixed penalties, say £100, doubling each time, up to a maximum, of say, £3200, every time a person is in breach of this rule.

rejection.details:
Littering is already a criminal offence with a maximum fine of £2,500. Fixed penalty notices (between £50-80) are also often used in lieu of prosecution in the courts.

We have already published a number of petitions calling for the Government to increase penalties and enforcement of littering rules, which you might like to sign:

Increase penalties, enforcement and education to tackle littering & fly tipping: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

Introduce heavy fixed penalties starting at £1000 minimum for littering: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334297

We have also published a petition calling on the Government to ban the use of disposable face masks and plastic gloves in public places, because of the environmental impact of these products: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324857

Decisions about enforcement of fines and prosecutions for littering offences is a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action:
Rayer’s Petition:
Review littering in the U.K.
attributes.background: We are asking MP’s from all parties to acknowledge the damaging & severe effects from littering & fly tipping.
attributes.additional_details: The aim is to reduce litterIng & fly tipping in our environment & to promote the heath of our environment & wildlife. We are petitioning for more severe penalties for anyone found to be littering/fly tipping. We are also petitioning for a review of the support required to police these illegal activities

rejection.details:
Increase penalties, enforcement and education to tackle littering & fly tipping:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of disposable BBQ's.
attributes.background: I would like to have these items removed from sale and have using them in a public place made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: Disposable BBQ's are responsible for many fires in the UK, in our local and national parks and areas of natural beauty. They are not actually very good at cooking and often used by people in an unsafe manner. They leave burns dotted about our green spaces that do not recover well as the soil is sterilised by the heat. They are often discarded thoughtlessly, while still alight, and create a significant hazard to wildlife and livestock. They also end up polluting rivers, lakes, fields and woods.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Make it illegal for dogs to be off lead
attributes.background: Lately, I’ve seen so many posts about loose dogs slaughtering sheep, wildlife, attacking children and causing bodily harm, and I think it could be avoided if all dogs were prohibited from being off lead. It would make the country a safer place.
attributes.additional_details: My friend’s cat was mauled to death yesterday by a loose dog, leaving herself and her son in compete devastation. A few days ago, a loose dog killed a baby goose near a pond. Where I live, there’s stories constantly about people being attacked by loose dogs. Please, so many livestock, beloved pets, wildlife, and other people are getting hurt unnecessarily because people refuse to be responsible dog owners.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318675

attributes.action: Allow all UK Zoos & Aquariums to open to the public
attributes.background: UK Zoos & Aquariums are under enormous financial pressure due to lockdown brought on by COVID-19. These attractions are very much able to implement strict social distancing measures that include hand sanitiser stations, one-way systems and ticket sale controls.
attributes.additional_details: Zoos & Aquariums are able to implement social distancing measures that are not currently in place at beaches and parks, which the public currently have access to. Letting Zoos & Aquariums open their gates to the public would save these attractions from financial ruin and closure, attractions that are paramount in the education of the UK public on wildlife conservation. Many conservation projects, both in-situ and ex-situ, would be hindered if Zoos & Aquariums were to collapse.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Allow Zoos and Wildlife attractions to reopen with social distancing in place: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323881

Provide financial help to zoos, aquariums, & rescue centres during the pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308733

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Ban the selling of disposable barbecues in the UK
attributes.background: Ban the sell of disposable barbecues. The type that are intended to be used once and then discarded.
attributes.additional_details: Disposable barbecues can start fires in heathlands and forests, cannot be recycled or composted and are environmentally unfriendly. Every year, emergency service resources are wasted tackling fires believed to be started by disposable barbecues, this was a possible cause of the large Wareham Forest fire responsible for destroying approximately 200 hectares of wildlife habitat. They often do not use FSC-certified charcoal and produce a foul odour that causes a nuisance to others in its vicinity.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable BBQs in public places
attributes.background: People are using these disposable BBQs in public places and areas such as national parks and beaches. They have been proven to be the cause of many devastating fires up and down the country and cause damage to the ground upon which they are used and also are often left as litter.
attributes.additional_details: They can be dangerous to the environment, wildlife and put people at risk who are called to extinguish any subsequent fire that they cause. Often they are not taken away as rubbish by those who have used them and they leave behind ugly patches of burnt grass. It seems that the public have no common sense when using these and do not consider the safety of themselves, others or their surroundings by using them. There needs to be a deterrent in the use of these in public places to protect us all.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Subject all mature trees to Tree Preservation Orders.
attributes.background: We need protection of all mature trees, as afforded to those in conservation areas, ensured in response to the Government declared Climate Emergency 1st May 2019. Mature trees are being removed without environmentally commensurate replacement, and with the life sustained by the tree already lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Trees store carbon and give us oxygen, vital for life. 
They provide habitat for wildlife and support biodiversity. 
In urban areas they reduce noise and capture pollutants from the air we breathe. They provide soil stability and reduce stormwater runoff, crucial for flood management. Trees provide shelter from wind and sun, and actively cool the surrounding air as well as enhancing our lives, giving us a sense of beauty and well being.

The right time to plant a tree is many decades ago.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300050

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for the police to respond to all grass fire.
attributes.background: A large number of grass fires have been a result of arson. Whilst some may be genuinely due to the extreme heat not all the fires are a result of this. The natural habitat of so much wildlife is being destroyed and lives are being put at risk as a result of the actions taken by those involved.
attributes.additional_details: The culprits need to be found and held accountable for those actions. If the police was to attend and investigate every fire then there would be a greater chance of catching those responsible and ultimately decreasing the amount of fire saving miles of natural habitat, save thousands and thousands of pounds and free up fire and rescue service to attend real emergencies.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is an operational decision for the police.

attributes.action: Reduce speed limit on country roads and to further protect wild animals
attributes.background:
Reduce speed limits on country roads and/or to find further preventative measures.

We must help protect our wildlife and promote conservation. Please help me get justice for these beautiful animals and all wildlife
attributes.additional_details:
Awful injustice. Every year animals are injured or die. whether a freak accident, or recklessness and irresponsible driving.
 
We should treat our wild deer like the deer at Windsor Park, which are protected. I witnessed a lady hit a deer. It was struck down like skittles.
 
 Most of the cars drive off, not notify police, report.Lady didn't contact police.
It's an offence and a crime to commit a human hit & run, or to drive over pets. Why is it not illegal or an offence to run over wildlife.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about wildlife being involved in road traffic collisions, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

It's not clear if you just want the Government to reduce the national speed limit for country roads, and if so what to, or if you also want the Government to take other action, and if so what.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to reduce the national speed limit for country roads, but you'd need to be clear what you wanted this to be reduced to. We could also accept a petition calling on the Government to require motorists to report a card accident involving any animal, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Ban Gillnetters over 15m in Scottish waters
attributes.background: We want Government to recognise that gillnetting is one of the most destructive techniques of fishing in the world and we ask for a total ban on industrial gillnetters operating in Scottish waters
attributes.additional_details: Gillnetting kills enormous by-catch and destroys wildlife in a very cruel manner.It has a major negative impact on marine species and fish stocks. It destoy's our shores and beaches with plastic discard. Evidence of tons of discarded fishing gear by EU owned boats is being dredged up on a daily basis by local boats. Please support sustainable responsible fishing, fight to improve the environment and reduce wildlife cruelty caused on an idustrial scale by EU owned gillnetters

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. Specifically, the licensing of fishing vessels is the responsibility of Marine Scotland, a Scottish Government agency. This means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into this issue.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Citizen Participation and Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

attributes.action: I want to see all Councils grow wildflowers on grass verges and on roundabouts.
attributes.background:
Planting wildflowers not only looks attractive but it also help the environment and the wildlife.  Councils would save money not having to cut the grass verges & roundabouts for a while.
We need to help the Bees and other insects thrive because the world needs them.
attributes.additional_details: To help the environment issues and the decreasing bee & insect population. It’s a reasonably cheap thing to achieve and the Government could ask & encourage the councils to do this.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Require local authorities replace roadside grass with wild flowers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616394

Fund the planting of wildflowers along all public green spaces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607277

attributes.action: Stop the overdevelopment of the blue lake in Northfleet, Kent.
attributes.background: The government should protect the local wildlife nature environment as it did for the Swanscombe Peninsula from greed and interests. https://www.kentonline.co.uk/gravesend/news/plans-to-infill-lake-with-thousands-of-homes-267302/?fbclid=IwAR2xqcj8sFJHobNfMvh22B_6hNF2zY7lG0wDfaeH6Veyx7MWYlNyLfdOBwQ
attributes.additional_details: Our natural habitat and environment is threatened daily by the increased level of pollutants we need to preserve the areas that have created a self sustaining natural environment home of many species of wildlife and plants that may not ve able to survive if their habitat is destroyed.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Suspend major development applications on green belt and protected land: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616891

attributes.action: Ban fireworks with noise - noiseless ones exist.
attributes.background: Every year parliament debates banning the sale of fireworks to the public. Every year they refuse. We know the government won’t ban something they make too much tax from, but given noiseless fireworks exist, why are they not as a bare minimum, the only fireworks being sold?
attributes.additional_details:
Every year there are devastating consequences for pets and wildlife (notably https://www.itv.com/news/westcountry/2020-11-10/young-zebra-died-after-being-spooked-by-fireworks-at-noahs-ark-zoo), alongside many people with PTSD or illnesses such as Autism. Banning the sale of noisy fireworks would at least make a difference for them. 
This will not account for despicable members of society acting dangerously with fireworks, but will at least make a difference for the groups mentioned above.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make fireworks quieter: Review and reduce the decibel limit on fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590838

Ban use and sale of non-silent fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599451

attributes.action: Limit the sound level of fireworks.
attributes.background: It is probably asking too much to ban fireworks completely, but they have got out of hand over the last twenty years. The main problem is the volume of the explosions and the irresponsibility of people letting them off late into the night. We were happy with the colours, fizzes and pops in the past.
attributes.additional_details: Many hours of noise is distressing for all wildlife, pets and PTSD sufferers. The high levels have also become generally antisocial. There can be little justification for bonfires and fireworks in these times of environmental crisis. Why do we have to replicate a WWI battle to mark explosions that never actually happened over 500 years ago? Possessing such explosives in any other situation would be illegal. Go back to oohs and aahs, rather than running for cover. The majority have had enough.

rejection.details:
Fireworks are already limited to producing noises of 120 dBA or lower as long as the observer is standing the recommended distance away, but we have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make fireworks quieter: Review and reduce the decibel limit on fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590838

Ban use and sale of non-silent fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599451

attributes.action: Stricter laws for cat owners
attributes.background: I would like to see laws introduced that make cat owners responsible for cats damaging others properties, soiling private and public areas and causing harm to wildlife and humans outside of their home.
attributes.additional_details: As a dog owner I am responsible to ensure that my dog is not to cause harm to others soil others properties and public spaces and to avoid any potential damage to properties, cat owners however have 0 restrictions in place to ensure that their animal does not cause any harm, damage or soiling private and public areas. I believe there should be more restrictions put in place to ensure that cats owners are held responsible for their animals.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588684

attributes.action: Help Turkey!
attributes.background:
At present, Turkey is battling major wildfires without adequate support and firefighting equipment. They are not able to fight this alone! 

We would like government to send help to preserve life and wildlife!
attributes.additional_details:
More than 70 wildfires have broken out in the past week in provinces on Turkey’s Aegean and Mediterranean coasts as well as the inland areas. There are many images showing the devastation caused by the deadly fires that continue to burn. Death toll currently seems to be at 8 but this is likely to go up with many more injuries. People are losing their homes and livelihoods. 

Turkey needs help! I am asking you all to sign this petition and share it with your contacts in the name of humanity.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: 

Help Turkey with the wildfires
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593834

attributes.action: Establish mandatory buffer zones of a minimum of 10 metres,next to watercourses.
attributes.background: Our rivers and streams are part of our National Infrastructure. River and stream margins protect our rivers and streams, store water, clean water, provide important habitat for our wildlife and store carbon. Many of our margins are lost through agriculture and development.
attributes.additional_details:
Development on floodplains is a prime cause of catastrophic flooding.
Soil erosion from fields cost the taxpayer £150million per year (Cranfield University 2009) Margins stop the soil leaving the fields.
The mandatory buffer zones will reduce the run-off into rivers of pesticides and fertilisers used in agriculture.
 Wilder river and stream corridors created through mandatory buffer zones  will reduce flooding, reduce pollution, capture carbon, help biodiversity, help business and help people

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about development near watercourses, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition calls for "buffer zones", but doesn't say what these should involve.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Stop subsidising the fishing industry with taxpayers money.
attributes.background: Stop subsidising fishing trade and focus the taxpayers money on conserving our oceans and its wildlife..
attributes.additional_details: The statistics are plain to see, not just overfishing and plastic waste in our oceans from discarded fishing equipment, but the humanitarian crisis in the Asian fishing trade and the piracy in African waters. So called marine charities that are supposed to be regulating safe and sustainable fishing only exist to profit from the mass fishing in the first place! If the fishing industry cant support itself then its obviously time for the industry to die, just as you allowed with the coal industry.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581530

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for dogs to be on leads on public rights of way
attributes.background: In light of all the dog attacks that have occurred recently, I believe the government should make it mandatory for dogs to be kept on leads, specifically on public rights of way: public footpaths, bridleways and byways. Too many horses, dogs, wildlife and sheep get attacked by out of control dogs.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to be changed so that dogs must be kept on a lead, specifically on public footpaths, bridleways and byways to protect livestock, equestrians and wildlife. If people do not obey the law, then there should be a significant financial penalty. Too many animals are being put at risk due to irresponsible dog owners which appears to be a majority, not a minority; mainly due to owners not understanding/caring about current legislation regarding having control of their dogs in public spaces

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569074

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to create new wildlife habitats if demolishing existing areas.
attributes.background: Make it mandatory for corporations to build new wildlife habitats when demolishing existing areas wildlife reside. If it is an area that has trees/plants growing and therefore clearly wildlife living there, then new wildlife habitats should be built to counterbalance the loss of habitat for animals.
attributes.additional_details:
Wildlife already have limited space due to human expansion and are suffering greatly due to human behaviour. Demolishing areas full of trees, shrubs, plants etc to make way for a corporation such as supermarkets is only adding to the problem instead of helping to reduce it.
Corporations should be required to counterbalance the loss of wildlife habitat when building by creating protected areas for wildlife to reside and clearly display to the public what exactly they have done to offset the loss.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578554

attributes.action: Reduce plastic waste in the oceans and limit it in everyday life
attributes.background: The UK produces five million tonnes of plastic every year. Only 9% of all global plastic is recycled. This needs to be changed. 88% of our ocean's surface is plastic, and that's bound to increase if we don't narrow down our plastic use and stop dumping it into the oceans.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic has been found in more than 60% of all seabirds and 100% of all sea turtle species, who mistake the plastics for food (Ocean Conservancy). It is estimated that 1.1 to 8.8 million tonnes of plastic waste enter our oceans each year (Wikipedia). Not to mention that many chemicals used to make plastic are known to be carcinogenic and interfere with the body's hormones causing reproductive, neurological and immune disorders in both humans and wildlife. These figures need to be changed.

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about plastic waste in the oceans, however it's not clear what specific actions you want the Government to take to reduce it. 

If there are specific actions you'd like the Government to take to reduce plastic waste, you could start a petition about that.

You may also like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553651
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331061
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570065
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573514

attributes.action: Stop the proposed Westley Green development from gaining planning permission
attributes.background: A new garden city is proposed at Six Mile Bottom, Cambridgeshire and the surrounding area. 8,500 new houses would be built on 1,350 acres of farmland. We do not want our village to be developed into a town, we chose to live in a quiet rural area, with thriving wildlife and historical buildings.
attributes.additional_details: The increase in traffic and proposed metro link would be detrimental to the wildlife, regardless of the efforts to make this a 'green' town. Many of us, having lived here for decades, would feel pushed out of our homes as it would not be the place we loved and recognised anymore.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Planning decisions are the responsibility of local councils.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of loud banging fireworks!
attributes.background: Make fireworks causing unnecessary loud bangs illegal. Allow only silent fireworks to be purchased and used in professional and personal displays throughout the year to support animals and pets from being terified.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks are used all over the world to celebrate different religious and cultural events. However over the years fireworks have become increasingly and unnecessarily loud, causing wildlife and pets to be scared and have anxiety. Each year thousands of dogs and other pets (or wildlife) are scared due to the unnecessary loud bangs of fireworks, sometimes leads to death. Making these fireworks illegal and use silent fireworks will help animals to be more relaxed and calm during these events.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

While some fireworks are marketed as silent, these still make some noise. If you would like the Government to reduce the decibel limit to a specific level, you could start a new petition requesting this.

We have also published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Ban the use of all fireworks in order to reduce air and noise pollution: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: Stop the sale of fireworks to the general public.
attributes.background:
There are countless stories of how fireworks are used to cause damage, inflict pain and disrupt the peace. 
They are used to throw at people walking their dogs, posted through letter boxes, thrown at cars and wildlife and used as ammo at protests. 
They are too dangerous to be given to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
One woman was in a car with her children when one of a group of boys threw a firework underneath it." 

One of the many scenes of when fireworks have been purposely used to cause trouble. 
There shouldn't be an option for this to happen. 

People's and animal's lives are being put at risk by idiots who use these items. I am aware that many people use fireworks appropriately, but even then, there are animals and children that are hurt and terribly frightened by the unexpected loud noises.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

attributes.action: To only allow low noise fireworks to be sold across the UK
attributes.background: Everyone enjoys fireworks for the creativity and colours. Not the loud bangs that affect my anxiety and also my dogs! Standard fireworks should be made illegal to manufacture and sell across the UK. They should be replaced with low noise fireworks and made a legal requirement across the country.
attributes.additional_details: I’m not suggesting a ban on fireworks. But loud bangs aren’t necessary to enjoy a firework display and there has been the technology to quieten them for 30 years! Not only does it affect people with health conditions like anxiety, autism and PTSD. It also affects pets (like dogs), wildlife (deers/birds) and children as it frightens them. The world health organisation lists 120 decibels as threshold for sound. Fireworks can reach between 150-170 decibels! Low noise fireworks can reach around 70-90 decibels and can be brighter in colour. Half the noise! Imagine how much better that’ll be? The technology is there and it will help many. Let’s stop the loud, unnecessary bangs!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

attributes.action: Put water fountains in public to reduce people buying single-use plastic bottles
attributes.background: Putting water fountains in public spaces will mean that people buy less single use plastic bottles. Plastic is destroying our Earth, clogging our oceans and killing our wildlife. Water fountains will let you refill your bottle without polluting the oceans.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic pollution is becoming a big problem (by 2050 there will be more plastic than fish in the oceans). Water fountains in public are common in other European countries - so why aren’t they here? It is a free way for people to save the environment. Placing just one water fountain in a public space could save our Earth and stop polluting our seas. There isn’t a Planet B so we need to do all we can to stop this plastic problem.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334268

attributes.action: Government should legislate towards the use of mute, silent or quiet fireworks.
attributes.background: The drawbacks of fireworks is the noise they generate can scare pets, wildlife and the vulnerable causing distress, disorientation and anxiety.  The panic by the noise of fireworks has been observed among birds and wildlife, often with tragic consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Current legislation allows for public use of fireworks 16 hours a day, every day.  The Petitions Committee inquiry in 2019 concluded that it would not be appropriate for the Government to ban the public use of fireworks.  The government should look at alternatives. Collecchio, Italy have successfully moved towards Fireworks that are marketed as mute, silent or quiet fireworks.  I petition the government to legislate towards the use of mute, silent or quiet fireworks to protect the vulnerable.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

attributes.action: OUT OF HOURS DROP-OFF OPTION NEEDED TO SAVE WILDLIFE
attributes.background:
Many animals that I myself have experienced suffer greatly due to Leck of urgent care during late evenings and nights.
This After hours option is needed to those willing to bring the animals to the centers.
attributes.additional_details:
No urgent care when its a life and death situation.
Instead they end up in peoples homes or left on the side of a road.
We so desperately want to get the animals the help it needs to Survive and then deeply saddened,lefted helpless when we are told there's no help available. 
Wildlife in the UK are loved and a great importance to us all. 
We need to save all the wildlife we can at this time of crisis. 
Give our wildlife the love and care when they need us the most. 
SAVE THEM, SAVE US.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332097

The Government is not currently responsible for veterinary care for animals, but the request made by the above petition would make the Government responsible for this, which could include providing out of hours services.

attributes.action: Ban fireworks for general sale to the public
attributes.background: Every year from October onwards people, pets and wildlife suffer long-lasting hurt and trauma from fireworks.  Shops sell them too early; the fireworks are getting noisier and more dangerous, and those who buy them use them irresponsibly and seem unaware of the impact of the noise on animals.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Ban the use of all fireworks in order to reduce air and noise pollution: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: UK government to aid Mauritius in “State of Environment Emergency”
attributes.background:
To help Mauritius with cleaning up the ocean.

Mauritius is a tiny beautiful island, previously owned by British and French Colony.
attributes.additional_details:
Unfortunately on the 6th August a Japanese oil rig ship (The MV Wakashio)  has leaked 1,000 tonnes into the surrounding Ocean.

Locals are doing their best to clean up the environment and protect what remaining wildlife can save.

Mauritius is a beautiful island which relays on its clear seas and sandy beaches for tourism industry and fishing export.

Please help! We need the British Government to help as soon as possible!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334440

attributes.action: Allow UK wildlife centres to open
attributes.background: Allow UK Zoos, aquariums and wildlife sanctuaries to open in line with Covid-19 safety measures
attributes.additional_details: Wildlife sanctuaries in the UK are struggling financially due to having no visitors during the lockdown. Many of these organisations occupy acres of outside space and have the room and capacity to allow visitors in whilst maintaining social distancing. They have also all planned to reopen and have safety measures in place such as limiting numbers or booking time slots, however have been told try cannot open. Meanwhile, much less safe areas like garden centres and shops are being allowed to open.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues in the UK.
attributes.background: We should ban disposable barbecues from sale in the UK. They are used incorrectly too often causing sometimes huge moorland fires.
attributes.additional_details:
Disposable barbecues used incorrectly are causing sometimes huge moorland fires all over the UK during the dry periods we've been having over the last few years using valuable emergency resource, damaging fragile environments and killing wildlife.
They are also ecologically unsound (best case is they go to landfill) and should be banned. 
They are dangerous when left unattended staying very hot for hours and contain a sharp metal mesh which can easily injure wildlufe or people coming across in unexpectedly.
Unfortunately people cannot be trusted to use these correctly as events through the years have shown.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Ban thé bang in fireworks
attributes.background: This is simple still have fireworks but remove the bang that causes so much pain in our pets, wildlife, veterans and autistic children
attributes.additional_details: I would like to ban the bang in fireworks. For people with pets this is very traumatic and we are a pet loving nation. Then think of all the wildlife that will be traumatised. Then children with autism and then veterans.we are supposed to be a caring nation but looking at all the rejected petitions i wonder.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Ban helium balloons

attributes.additional_details: Ban the use of the helium filled balloons.

attributes.action: Support Farmers and Fishermen to Produce only Vegan Food and Care for Animals
attributes.background: Each year, around 80 million fish and 1.2 billion land animals are killed to be eaten in the UK alone each year. Worldwide, 77 billion land animals and around 1 trillion to 2.8 trillion fish are killed each year. This has to stop. We all need to go vegan, for the planet and the animals!
attributes.additional_details:
Everyone should go vegan to stop animal slaughter. We also need to try to make a vegan world possible without having to kill any remaining animals, and keep a vastly smaller number of farm animals around. They could be cared for in refuges.
 We also need to rewild as much of the rest of the land as possible, to help restore our planet, tackle climate change and save wildlife. If it weren’t for animal agriculture, it would also be easier to reintroduce native predators like wolves and bears.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to support a shift to veganism, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do. We could accept a petition calling on the Government withdraw all financial support for animal agriculture and fisheries, but it's not clear how fishermen could be involved in producing vegan food.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

The Vegan Petition - Ban Animal Agriculture and Animal Products: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614487

attributes.action: Re-instate regular local government residential services to semi-rural areas.
attributes.background: Provide sufficient funding to councils to ensure that appropriate staff levels are maintained to carry out essential services.
attributes.additional_details:
In the East Hants semi rural areas have become unkempt, scruffy & dirty. These are services residents have paid for.  
1.Grass verges in many areas are a danger to motorists, pedestrians and pose a health risk to humans and animals.
2. Weeds on the roadside/ edge of pavements are now so established that they are damaging the fabric of roads and pavements.
3. Bottle collections are not happening on a regular basis. 
4. Wildlife carcasses at the side of the road are not being collected.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about provision of services along the lines outlined in your petition are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding to local authorities for certain services, but it would still be up to individual local authorities what, if any, changes to make to the services it provides.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Large Artificial Plants, Flowers and Grass
attributes.background:
The use and sales of artificial plants and grass is utterly unacceptable in 2022 - we need a ban
- Damages and contaminates the structure of the soil
- Manufacturing and delivery contributes to carbon emissions
- Plastic grass can’t or won’t be recycled
- They have no wildlife benefit whatsoever
attributes.additional_details: Think about the environmental impact of allowing the sale of artificial plants and grass. As a country we want to decrease carbon emissions but we are allowing the sale of these items?! I'm asking you to do a report on the impact to the environment and ban the sale of these goods.

rejection.details:
We understand you would like the sale of artificial grass, flowers and plants to be banned, but we're not sure whether you want this ban to apply to all artificial plants and flowers, or only those intended to be planted outdoors (where there might be any risk of 'damaging and contaminating the structure of the soil').

You may like to sign these petitions which call for similar actions: 

Introduce an "Ecological Damage Tax" on Astroturf Lawns / Artificial Grass: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608295

Ban the sale and use of fake grass: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617801

attributes.action: Halt new housing development until new sewage processing infrastructure is built
attributes.background: Halt approval for new housing development in Oxfordshire until new sewage processing infrastructure is built that can deal with future demand as well as future flooding events WITHOUT polluting our rivers with raw sewage.
attributes.additional_details: Wildlife and ecosystems are dying due to lack of government funding in sewage processing infrastructure. This has led to a situation where sewage plants cannot deal with current demand. Meanwhile new housing projects proliferate wherever you look which will only add to the problem. We need to address the root cause and solve it. Plan and build new sewage processing infrastructure that will cope with future demands plus future flooding events without releasing raw sewage into our rivers.

rejection.details:
Decisions relating to applications for planning permission are a matter for the relevant local authority - in this case, Oxfordshire County Council - not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could have a petition calling for the Government to provide local authorities with funding to improve sewage processing infrastructure, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601730

attributes.action: Safeguard hedgerow habitat in the payment of field border set-aside subsidies
attributes.background:
Ensure that payments for field border set-aside allocations are made ONLY where accompanying hedgerow is sustainably managed.

Disallow tractor-driven rotary or flail blade hedge cutting on an annual/bi-annual basis to constitute 'sustainability' and legislate against it in subsidy allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
Hedgerow habitat is essential for a broad spectrum of wildlife across the UK ecosystem. Yet Government-granted subsidies for field border set-aside strips do not presently include hedgerow within the scope of protection.

We ask that annual and biannual cutting of hedge lines with tractor-driven machinery will disqualify the landowner from receipt of these subsidies, since this practice significantly reduces wildlife support and current grants do not represent good value for the tax payer.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about payments for set-aside agricultural land and protection of hedgerows, but we're not sure if all you want is for hedgerows that are subject to annual or biannual cutting with tractor-driven machinery to be made ineligible for these payments, or if you want there to be other requirements for the safeguarding of any hedgerows covered by these payments.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Create law that front gardens must comprise of plants
attributes.background: We need a law to protect front gardens from being completely obliterated with man-made materials, ensuring that there are plants in every single one for wildlife. At least one-third of all front gardens should be comprised of plants, be that grass, flowers, shrubs or trees.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there are no laws on how much of a front garden can be left for nature with many now being tarmacked or slabbed over, resulting in less space for wildlife and so diminishing biodiversity. In order to limit global temperature warming and increase insect populations, we need to be utilising this vital space of the front garden to take it back to what it should be - a front garden. We need more plants and trees to act as carbon stores, and more flowers for pollinators.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how to maintain domestic gardens are a matter for the homeowner, not the UK Government or Parliament.
